instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-2915: What is 820-2915? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2915</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no backlight
threads.message:
hi,

i am just working on that board

have video with lamp behind the lcd but no backlight.

i already figured out that the pwm signal is 0V and without  <RESISTOR>R9704</RESISTOR> and 3.3 V direct on <CHIP>U9701</CHIP> Pin 4 i get nice backlight

so i thought (<RESISTOR>R9704</RESISTOR> both sides is 0V) the GMUX is the prolem

i reballed the GMUX but still the same problems 

is here the GMUX bad ? or what signals has to come in for a good PWM output?

is the GPU involved?

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2915</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no backlight
threads.message: PRAM reset?? Else the MUS is bad. And next month the GPU will die.

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2915</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no backlight
threads.message:
thanks for your answer

so the PRAM reset is without change

i will goibg forward to replace the mux. is it possible to take any from any 2915?

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2915</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no backlight
threads.message: so, gmux is replaced and Duke, thanks, backlight is back !! yippii
